Aaron Gilmore is a designer based in Belfast, Northern Ireland. He specialises in interface and interaction design on the web, front-end web development, and interaction design for iOS.

About

I'm an independent designer and developer based in Belfast, and a final year student of Interactive Design at the University of Ulster.

I'm currently working on Slim; a simple weight management app for iOS.

I previously worked as a product designer at Brewbot and before that, I worked as design intern at Ecliptic Labs—an award-winning iOS and Android app development company.

I'm available for freelance work. If you want to discuss a project, you can email me at aaron@aarongilmore.com or tweet me @aarondgilmore. If you want to know more about me, please view my résumé.

Work

Selected projects from the past two years.

Slim (2014-present)

Slim is an iOS app for keeping track of your body weight. I'll share more on this in the coming weeks.

Brewbot (2012-2014)

Brewbot is a beer-brewing robot that is controlled and monitored using a smartphone. The project came to be through a love of craft beer and a successful Kickstarter campaign, launced at XOXO in Portland in September 2013.

In 2014, Brewbot was accepted onto the Techstars program in Austin, TX. It has since been featured on Techcrunch, Mashable, Fast Company, Offscreen Magazine, and New Scientist.

Other

Bolder is a website celebrating older people who are doing interesting work in their respective industries. I lead the front-end development on this project.

I also worked on the Brewbot Tour website. The Brewbot Tour consisted of a tour around Ireland's top craft breweries in July 2014.
